skilllist.skilldesc: Damage dealt by Hanzo's Basic Attacks and skills inflicts a stack of <font color="a6aafb">Dark Ninjutsu</font> on the target, up to 5 stacks. <font color="a6aafb">Ninjutsu: Demon Feast</font> can only be cast on targets with full stacks of <font color="a6aafb">Dark Ninjutsu</font>.

The skill can only be used on targets with max stacks of <font color="a6aafb">Dark Ninjutsu</font>. When targeting a creep, Hanzo will immediately devour it and digest it over a period of time to recover 20% HP.
When targeting the Turtle/Lord/enemy heroes, deals 600<font color="fba51f"> (+120% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font>, recovers 10% HP, and reduces this skill's cooldown by 60%.

Hanzo dashes in the target direction, leaving <font color="a6aafb">dark mist</font> in front that deals 90<font color="fba51f"> (+45% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to enemies in the area every 0.5s, up to 5 times (this damage counts as Basic Attack damage but cannot Crit).
The <font color="a6aafb">dark mist</font> slows enemies in the area by 40% and grants Hanzo 20% Movement Speed.

Hanzo charges into battle as <font color="a6aafb">Hanekage</font>, consuming 17 Energy per second. He gains 2 Energy when a non-hero unit dies nearby and 20 Energy when it's a hero. After consuming all his Energy, Hanzo's body will be slowly drawn to Hanekage's current position.
While in Hanekage form, Hanzo's body is invincible, and Hanekage ignores obstacles and gains 50% Movement Speed (decays over time) and 30% Attack Speed.
After being killed, <font color="a6aafb">Hanekage</font> will be immediately drawn to Hanzo's position, during which he recovers 16% HP and cannot be targeted. This effect is also triggered when the skill is cast again. If <font color="a6aafb">Hanekage</font> is killed, Hanzo will be slowed by 50% and reveal his location for 6s.

Damage dealt by Hanzo's Basic Attacks and skills inflicts a stack of <font color="a6aafb">Dark Ninjutsu</font> on the target, up to 5 stacks. <font color="a6aafb">Ninjutsu: Demon Feast</font> can only be cast on targets with full stacks of <font color="a6aafb">Dark Ninjutsu</font>.

Hanekage dashes to an enemy hero, dealing 300<font color="fba51f"> (+60% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to the target and its surrounding units after a brief delay. Each stack of <font color="a6aafb">Dark Ninjutsu</font> on the target increases the damage by 20% (surrounding units are not affected by this bonus). When the target has max stacks of <font color="a6aafb">Dark Ninjutsu</font>, it deals additional damage equal to 15<font color="fba51f"> (+2% Extra Physical Attack)</font>% of the target's Max HP (this damage ignores 30% of the target's Physical Defense) and recovers 20% HP for Hanzo.

Hanekage dashes in the target direction, briefly knocking enemies in his path airborne for 0.4s and leaving <font color="a6aafb">dark mist</font> in the area he passes through (recovers 20 Energy when hitting an enemy hero). The mist deals 135<font color="fba51f"> (+45% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color="fb1f1f">Physical Damage</font> to enemies in the area every 0.5s, up to 5 times (this damage counts as Basic Attack damage but cannot Crit).
The <font color="a6aafb">dark mist</font> slows enemies in the area by 40%.
Hanekage returns to Hanzo's body and exits the Hanekage form.

data.name: Hanzo
data.story: Genius ninja in the Shadow Sect who is at the crossroads.

assist.desc: Hanzo has high burst potential but needs time to stack his Passive, so he works best with heroes who can keep the enemy CC'd, like Aurora, Belerick, and Tigreal.

strong.desc: Hanzo's Ultimate enables him to poke or dive with relative safety, making him a serious threat to squishy heroes without mobility, like Layla, Ixia, and Zhuxin, while also disrupting the enemy in teamfights.

weak.desc: Hanzo fares less favorably against heroes with lots of mobility, such as Fanny, Lancelot, and Arlott, since it's difficult to build stacks on them, thus limiting Hanzo's damage.
